title: [BUG] regex `^.*literal` cannot be rewritten as `contains(literal)` for multiline strings
body:
**Describe the bug**
In regex, wildcard `.` matches any single character except line break characters ([link](https://github.com/rapidsai/cudf/blob/382de32e8137a3a59a0800f46ef8a1de62b1a6e5/cpp/doxygen/regex.md#basic-features)). So In regex rewrite, patterns like `^.*literal` cannot be rewritten as `contains(literal)` if the input string contains line break characters, because some line break chars could appear before the `literal` and make the pattern mismatch.

**Steps/Code to reproduce bug**
This case was surprisingly missed in the integration test `test_rlike_rewrite_optimization`, when we added this pattern in the test it failed.

```python
def test_rlike_rewrite_optimization_start_wildcard():
    gen = mk_str_gen('[ab\n]{3,6}')
    assert_gpu_and_cpu_are_equal_collect(
            lambda spark: unary_op_df(spark, gen).selectExpr(
                'a',
                'rlike(a, "^.*(aaa)")'),
        conf=_regexp_conf)
```

```diff
--- CPU OUTPUT
+++ GPU OUTPUT
@@ -17,7 +17,7 @@
 Row(a='a\nabb', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
 Row(a='abb\n\n', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
 Row(a='\naa', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
-Row(a='\naaab', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
+Row(a='\naaab', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=True)
 Row(a='ba\n\n', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
 Row(a='\naa\n\n', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
 Row(a='\n\n\nb', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
@@ -101,7 +101,7 @@
 Row(a='a\n\nab', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
 Row(a='ab\nb\nb', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
 Row(a='bba\n\nb', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
-Row(a='\nabaaa', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
+Row(a='\nabaaa', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=True)
 Row(a='bbaab\n', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
 Row(a='\n\naab', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
 Row(a='a\nbaba', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
@@ -126,7 +126,7 @@
 Row(a='ba\n\n\na', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
 Row(a='b\n\n\na\n', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
 Row(a='baaaaa', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=True)
-Row(a='\n\naaab', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
+Row(a='\n\naaab', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=True)
 Row(a='b\nb\n\n\n', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
 Row(a='\n\nb\naa', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
 Row(a='bbbaba', RLIKE(a, ^.*(aaa))=False)
```

**Expected behavior**
cpu's and gpu's results should match.
